trans-unit.source: Represents an automatically generated field in a data-bound control.
This class cannot be inherited.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField> class is used to represent an automatically generated field in a data-bound control, such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView>.

Automatically generated fields are created by a data-bound control when the appropriate property is set to `true` (for example, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.AutoGenerateColumns%2A> property for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.AutoGenerateRows%2A> property for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control, and so on).

Automatically generated fields are not added to the field collection of a data-bound control (for example, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.Columns%2A> collection for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.Fields%2A> collection for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control, and so on).
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField> class is intended for use internally by data-bound controls.

Unlike other data fields (such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BoundField>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxField>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplateField>, and so on), the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField> class cannot be placed declaratively on a page as part of a field collection.
Although you can programmatically add an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField> object to a field collection, this design pattern should be avoided.

Because automatically generated fields represent the automatic rendering of a field, data-bound controls do not typically allow users to modify the properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField> objects.
If the automatic rendering is not suitable for your needs, define your own data fields for the field collection of the control.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField"></xref> class with the specified data field.
Use this constructor to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField> class.

This constructor is generally used by data-bound controls (such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView>) when creating automatically generated fields.
The name of the data field to bind to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField"></xref>.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether empty string ("") values are converted to `null` when the field values are retrieved from the data source.
Sometimes a field's value is an empty string ("") in the data source.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField.ConvertEmptyStringToNull%2A> property is used to indicate whether empty string values are converted to `null` before being displayed in an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField>.
This version of the property has been implemented to always return `true`.
It is not possible to set this property.
Always returns `true`.
An attempt is made to set this property.
Gets or sets the string that specifies the format in which the alternate text for each image in an <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField"></xref> object is rendered.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField.DataFormatString%2A> property is used to apply a special format to the values displayed in an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField> object.
This version of the property has been implemented to always return an empty string to indicate that no special formatting is applied to the field values.
It is not possible to set this property.
Always returns an empty string ("").
An attempt is made to set this property.
Gets or sets the data type of the values displayed in an <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField"></xref> object.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField.DataType%2A> property to specify the data type of the values displayed in an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField> object.
The data type determines what type of control is rendered in an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField> object to display the value.
For example, a check box control is displayed when the type is <xref:System.Boolean>.
A <xref href="System.Type"></xref> that represents the data type of the value displayed in an <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField"></xref> object.
The default is <xref href="System.String"></xref>.

Fills the specified <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.IOrderedDictionary"></xref> object with the values from the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldCell"></xref> object.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField.ExtractValuesFromCell%2A> method is a helper method used to retrieve the values of the fields from the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldCell> object in an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField> object.
This method is primarily used by control developers.
This method does not have a return value.
Instead, the field values are returned by reference through the <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.IOrderedDictionary> object passed in for the `dictionary` parameter.
After the method has been called, iterate through the <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.IOrderedDictionary> object to access the field values.
To include the read-only field values in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldCell> object, pass in `true` for the `includeReadOnly` parameter.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.IOrderedDictionary"></xref> used to store the values of the specified cell.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldCell"></xref> that contains the values to retrieve.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowState"></xref> values.
The value `true` includes only the values of read-only fields; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField"></xref> object is visible in insert mode.

In data-bound controls that support inserting records (such as the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control), the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField.InsertVisible%2A> property is used to specify whether the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField> object is displayed when the data-bound control is in insert mode.
This version of the property has been implemented to always return `true`.
It is not possible to set this property.
Always returns `true`.
An attempt is made to set this property.
Determines whether the controls contained in an <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField"></xref> object support callbacks.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField.ValidateSupportsCallback%2A> method is the helper method used to determine whether the controls contained in an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AutoGeneratedField> object support callbacks.
This method has been implemented as an empty method (a method that does not contain any code) to indicate that callbacks are supported.
This method is primarily used by control developers.
Classes that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField> class can override this method to indicate whether the controls contained by the field support callbacks.

To indicate that callbacks are supported, implement this method as an empty method that does not throw an exception; otherwise, throw an exception with a useful message describing why callbacks are not supported.
